Package io.gitlab.chaver.mining.patterns.constraints.factory

Class ConstraintFactory

java.lang.Object
io.gitlab.chaver.mining.patterns.constraints.factory.ConstraintFactory
public class ConstraintFactory extends Object
A Constraint Factory to instantiate different data-mining constraints

  • Constructor Details

    • ConstraintFactory

      public ConstraintFactory()

  • Method Details

    • coverSize

      public static Constraint coverSize(TransactionalDatabase database, IntVar freq, BoolVar[] items)
      Given a transactional database, an integer variable freq and an array of Boolean variables that represents the itemset x, ensures that freq is equal to the frequency of x in the database.
      Parameters:
      database - Transactional database
      freq - Integer variable that represents the frequency of the itemset in the database
      items - Array of Boolean variables where items[i] == 1 indicates that i belongs to the itemset x
      Returns:
      The CoverSize constraint

    • coverClosure

      public static Constraint coverClosure(TransactionalDatabase database, BoolVar[] items)
      Given a transactional database and an array of Boolean variables that represents the itemset x, ensures that x is closed w.r.t. the frequency, i.e. there exists no superset of x that has the same frequency.
      Parameters:
      database - Transactional database
      items - Array of Boolean variables where items[i] == 1 indicates that i belongs to the itemset x
      Returns:
      The CoverClosure constraint

    • adequateClosure

      public static Constraint adequateClosure(TransactionalDatabase database, List<Measure> measures, BoolVar[] items, boolean dc)
      Given a transactional database, a list of measures M and an array of Boolean variables that represents the itemset x, ensures that x is closed w.r.t. M, i.e. there exists no superset y of x such that for each measure m in M we have m(x) = m(y). Two versions of the propagator are available : DC (Domain Consistency) and WC (Weak Consistency). It is recommended to use the WC version since it was proven to be more time efficient that the DC one.
      Parameters:
      database - Transactional database
      measures - List of measures
      items - Array of Boolean variables where items[i] == 1 indicates that i belongs to the itemset x
      dc - true if we want to use the DC version of the constraint, else the WC version is used
      Returns:
      the AdequateClosure constraint

    • frequentSubs

      public static Constraint frequentSubs(TransactionalDatabase database, int s, BoolVar[] items)
      Given a transactional database, a threshold s and an array of Boolean variables that represents the itemset x, ensures that each subset y of x is frequent, i.e. freq(y) ≥ s.
      Parameters:
      database - Transactional database
      s - Frequency threshold
      items - Array of Boolean variables where items[i] == 1 indicates that i belongs to the itemset x
      Returns:
      the FrequentSubs constraint

    • infrequentSupers

      public static Constraint infrequentSupers(TransactionalDatabase database, int s, BoolVar[] items)
      Given a transactional database, a threshold s and an array of Boolean variables that represents the itemset x, ensures that each superset y of x is infrequent, i.e. freq(y) < s.
      Parameters:
      database - Transactional database
      s - Frequency threshold
      items - Array of Boolean variables where items[i] == 1 indicates that i belongs to the itemset x
      Returns:
      the InfrequentSupers constraint

    • generator

      public static Constraint generator(TransactionalDatabase database, BoolVar[] items)
      Given a transactional database and an array of Boolean variables that represents the itemset x, ensures that x is a generator, i.e. there exists no subset of x that has the same frequency.
      Parameters:
      database - Transactional database
      items - Array of Boolean variables where items[i] == 1 indicates that i belongs to the itemset x
      Returns:
      the Generator constraint
